questions.question: Why does Zaroff end up on Ship-Trap Island?

choices.answer: He fled there after the debacle in Russia.
He bought it to build his chateau and play his game.
He inherited it from his family.
It was his only property after the revolution.

questions.question: Why does Rainsford come to Ship-Trap Island?

choices.answer: He falls overboard and swims there.
Whitney recommended the hunting there.
He wants to interview Zaroff for a new hunting book.
He wanted to challenge Zaroff to a hunting contest.

questions.question: Why does Zaroff hunt humans?

choices.answer: He wants a challenge of a reasoning creature.
He can not get big game on his island.
Animals have injured him too many times.
He misses the cruelty of life as a noble Cossack.

questions.question: Why is Zaroff so excited to see Rainsford?

choices.answer: He wants to share his secret with the world.
He needs someone to hunt.
He is glad to meet such a hunting expert.
He misses the outside world.

questions.question: When does Rainsford realize he will be hunted?

choices.answer: When he tries to get out of his room at night & finds it locked.
When Zaroff turns on the channel lights.
When he falls off the yacht.
When Zaroff says play or face Ivan.

questions.question: When does Zaroff reveal his knowledge of his own viciousness?

choices.answer: Telling Rainsford he hunts humans.
Telling Rainsford he misses war and killing.
When Rainsford questions Zaroff's civilized comment.
Explaining Ivan is a savage Cossack & saying he is a Cossack too.

questions.question: What is Zaroff's life philosophy?

choices.answer: There are 2 classes - hunters & huntees
Animals are more valuable than humans.
Only the rich deserve to live.
Only the strong deserve to survive.

questions.question: Who is dead by the end of the story?

choices.answer: Rainsford, Zaroff, and one dog.
Rainsford.
Zaroff, Ivan, and one dog.
Ivan, Rainsford, and a dog.

questions.question: What is the main external conflict?

choices.answer: Rainsford vs. Evil/Zaroff
Rainsford vs. the jungle
Rainsford vs. scruples
Zaroff vs. boredom

questions.question: How does Rainsford end up defeating Zaroff?

choices.answer: He swims to Z's chateau & surprises him.
His Malay Mancatcher wounds Z. enough so R. can go in for the kill.
He kills Ivan & the dogs, leaving Z. vulnerable.
He steals Ivan's gun and surprises Z.

questions.question: Why do readers think Z. has lost the duel to R.?

choices.answer: It said that Rainsford challenged Z. to a duel.
It said that the dogs had a delicious dinner that evening.
It said Rainsford had never slept in a better bed.
It said that R. was a better swordsman.

questions.question: What is NOT foreshadowing used in the story?

choices.answer: Rainsford stays up late smoking his pipe.
It was an eerily dark night.
Whitney says the Captain was freaked.
The title.

questions.question: What is an example of foreshadowing used in the story?

choices.answer: Zaroff explaining his wealth.
Ivan not speaking.
Zaroff serving filet mignon.
Zaroff having a bizarre quality.

questions.question: How does Zaroff stock his island?

choices.answer: Using fake channel lights.
Survivors of ship wrecks.
Providence causing wrecks.
ALL of the answers.

questions.question: What do we know about Ivan?

choices.answer: He is deaf and blind.
He was an official torturer to the czar.
He was a Cossack general.
He dies by the Burmese Tiger Pit.

questions.question: Why is Zaroff eager to take Rainsford to his library?

choices.answer: To show him his new collection of heads.
To show off his intelligence.
To show his extensive collection of books.
To show him the buffalo mount.

questions.question: What does Zaroff supply to players?

choices.answer: Directions and a map of the island.
Food, knife, 3 hour head start.
Food, knife, 12 hour head start.
Food, knife, gun

questions.question: What was NOT one of Rainsford's traps/tricks?

choices.answer: Ugandan knife
Malay monster crusher
Burmese tiger pit
Fox trail & climbing tree

questions.question: When does Zaroff use the dog/dogs?

choices.answer: After Rainsford had killed Ivan.
When opponents are too good.
When he gets tired of playing.
When they need to be fed.

questions.question: What happened as a result of the Burmese Tiger Pit?

choices.answer: Ivan was killed.
A dog was killed.
Zaroff was wounded.
Rainsford broke his hand.

questions.question: What happened as a result of the Ugandan Knife Trap?

choices.answer: A dog was killed.
Ivan was wounded.
Zaroff was wounded.
Ivan was killed.

questions.question: What is the correct order for plot?

choices.answer: rising action, exposition, climax, falling action, resolution
exposition, rising action, climax, falling action, resolution
exposition, rising action, falling action, climax resolution
exposition, rising action, climax, resolution

questions.question: Why does Zaroff believe he is civilized?

choices.answer: He has electricity.
He was a Russian nobleman.
He only kills scum.
He is an intelligent expert hunter.

questions.question: What was ominous foreshadowing about Zaroff's evilness?

choices.answer: He smiles warmly and welcomes Rainsford.
He is found to be staring at Rainsford while eating.
He uses hand gestures to communicate with Ivan.
He had white hair.

questions.question: What is NOT correct about Rainsford?

choices.answer: He is the protagonist.
He survived 3 days of the game.
He is the first opponent to injure Zaroff.
He committed cold-blooded murder.
